intro: Lucuma gardneriana, commonly known as the Peruvian sweet potato, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange fruit, which is rich in nutrients. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often growing along supports or trellises. Its fruit is typically harvested when fully mature, and it is valued for its sweet, creamy texture and nutritional benefits. Lucuma is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural sweeteners.
